Nasa’s Bennu asteroid holds secrets of life hidden for billions of years
description: Bennu asteroid samples returned by NASA's OSIRIS-REx mission reveal life's building blocks, including sugars like ribose and glucose. The asteroid's high concentration of supernova dust sheds light on its formation environment and the distribution of presolar materials in our early solar system.

title: Experts warn how overconsumption of chai in winter can cause stiffening in joints
description: Winter mornings often feature warm chai and coffee. However, health experts warn this habit can harm joint health. Excessive tea and coffee intake can lead to dehydration, stiffening joints, especially knees. This is because cold weather reduces water intake while increasing hot beverage consumption. Synovial fluid, crucial for joint lubrication, thickens when the body is dehydrated.

title: Delhi MCD bypolls: BJP sweeps major seats, AAP secures narrow wins; check full list of winners
description: The BJP secured a dominant victory in the Delhi Municipal Corporation bypolls, winning seven out of twelve wards. The AAP managed to win three seats, while the Congress and AIFB secured one each. This outcome is seen as a significant electoral test for the BJP following their recent rise to power in Delhi.

Her in-laws allegedly demanded a Royal Enfield motorcycle or Rs 2 lakh, forcibly took her gifts, and physically assaulted her. Police have registered a case against the groom and his family.

Eight senior players submitted an 18-point letter detailing allegations of mental harassment, prompting an investigation by Hockey India. The team's future hangs in the balance amidst calls for honesty and bold decisions.

title: Putin’s visit under Trump tariff shadow: What’s at stake for India and Russia?
description: Russian President Putin's India visit is crucial for trade dynamics amidst US pressure. India's energy security is now heavily reliant on discounted Russian crude, reshaping its procurement patterns. The visit aims to manage dependence in a fractured world, focusing on securing fuel, weapons, and payments.

description: An Indian national, Mohammed Asif, has been sentenced to two years in US federal prison for orchestrating a Medicare fraud scheme. His Everett-based lab, American Labworks LLC, billed over $8 million for unreceived Covid-19 and respiratory tests, defrauding Medicare of more than $1.1 million. Asif, who controlled the lab's finances, will also pay over $1.1 million in restitution.

description: IBM CEO Arvind Krishna attributes current tech layoffs to pandemic-era over-hiring, not AI, calling it a "natural correction." While acknowledging AI will cause some job displacement, Krishna believes increased productivity will lead to new roles and overall hiring growth, particularly for college graduates.

title: Mike Tyson reveals $40k monthly cannabis habit, says family urged him to restart
description: Mike Tyson revealed on a podcast that his family urged him to resume smoking cannabis after a brief five-day break, as his intense, unmedicated demeanor frightened them.  He explained that marijuana helps him manage his mood, maintain calm, and feel more like himself, contrasting it with the negative effects of alcohol.

title: 'Clocking speed of 140 kmph': Influencer dies in horrific crash; named his bike 'Laila'
description: An 18-year-old died after losing control of his KTM sports bike near Surat's Breadliner Circle. Speeding and reportedly not wearing a helmet, Prince Patel crashed into the road divider, sustaining fatal head injuries. He was known for posting high-speed bike videos on social media.

title: 'US falling behind': Ford CEO on worker shortage; company struggling to fill mechanic roles
description: Ford CEO Jim Farley warns of a critical US trade worker shortage, leaving 1 million jobs unfilled. He highlights a dangerous gap compared to China in building essential workforces, impacting national security. Farley advocates for rebuilding the blue-collar pipeline through investment in trade schools and education, emphasizing fair wages and career paths for workers.

title: Travis Kelce reportedly feels claustrophobic amid pressure before Taylor Swift wedding
description: Travis Kelce faces immense pressure planning his wedding with Taylor Swift.  The world watches their every move.  He juggles football, his podcast, businesses, and acting dreams.  Sources say he feels claustrophobic and overwhelmed.  Taylor Swift's security team is also on edge due to constant public attention.  Despite the stress, the couple remains focused on their season and wedding plans.
